title: Alexander on Douglass and emigration- explanation

content.question: According to Source 2, which of the following best explains why Frederick Douglass abandoned his support for emigration?

choices.label: The ratification of the Fourteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution secured citizenship rights for African Americans.
The Civil War created an opportunity to abolish slavery and achieve full integration for African Americans in the United States.
The federal government overturned Black Codes that prevented African Americans from accessing their suffrage rights.
The Fugitive Slave Act made movement within and outside of the United States too dangerous to encourage African Americans to attempt to emigrate elsewhere.

content.answer: The Civil War created an opportunity to abolish slavery and achieve full integration for African Americans in the United States.
